dt: {bc}loss of memory due usually to brain injury, shock, fatigue, repression, or illness
{bc}the selective overlooking or ignoring of events or acts that are not favorable or useful to one's purpose or position

dt.t: … Americans seemed to develop a willful forgetfulness about the nation's longest military conflict, an {wi}amnesia{/wi} that lasted for nearly a decade.

et: borrowed from New Latin {it}amnēsia,{/it} borrowed from Greek (Septuagint) {it}amnēsía{/it} "forgetfulness," variant of {it}amnēstía{/it} {ma}{mat|amnesty:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: loss of memory due usually to brain injury, shock, fatigue, repression, or illness
the selective overlooking or ignoring of events or acts that are not favorable or useful to one's purpose or position
